acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

anchorV4((uint48,bytes32,bytes32)).details: Core function that anchors L1 block data for cross-chain verification.

params._checkpoint: Checkpoint data for the L1 block being anchored.

params._checkpointStore: The address of the checkpoint store.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params._token: Token address or address(0) if Ether.

ANCHOR_GAS_LIMIT().notice: Gas limit for anchor transactions (must be enforced).

GOLDEN_TOUCH_ADDRESS().notice: Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.

anchorV4((uint48,bytes32,bytes32)).notice: Processes a block and anchors L1 data.

blockHashes(uint256).notice: Mapping from block number to block hash.

checkpointStore().notice: Checkpoint store for storing L1 block data.

getBlockState().notice: Returns the current block-level state snapshot.

init(address).notice: Initializes the owner of the Anchor.

paused().notice: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

resolver().notice: Returns the address of this contract.

withdraw(address,address).notice: Withdraw token or Ether from this address. Note: This contract receives a portion of L2 base fees, while the remainder is directed to L2 block's coinbase address.

documentation.text:
@notice Stored block-level state for the latest anchor.
 @dev 2 slots
@notice Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.
@notice Gas limit for anchor transactions (must be enforced).
@notice Checkpoint store for storing L1 block data.
@notice Mapping from block number to block hash.

@dev Slots used by the Pacaya anchor contract itself.
 slot1: publicInputHash
 slot2: parentGasExcess, lastSyncedBlock, parentTimestamp, parentGasTarget
 slot3: l1ChainId
@dev Deprecated. Retained for storage layout compatibility.
@notice Latest block-level state, updated on every processed block.

@notice Initializes the owner of the Anchor.
 @param _owner The owner of this contract
@notice Returns the current block-level state snapshot.

@dev Validates and processes block-level data.
 @param _checkpoint Anchor checkpoint data from L1.
